result.execSummary:
The defendant Darionta Dashaun Phifer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: All mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution including DNA..  
All court costs, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any Court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgmetn and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.

No firearms, ammunition, body armor.  No voting until rights have been restored.
No alcohol or drugs.
No contact with Mutual or 1000 feet of 2723 N. 20 Street.
No contact with Alex W., Jordan N. or Tyrell J.

Follow all rules of supervision.
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.   Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment

The Petition for Sentence Adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.

-   The court has reviewed the defendant's petition for sentence adjustment and the materials he attached. The court commends the defendant for his program participation, excellent work assignment evaluation, and for the improvement in his institutional conduct. However, after considering all relevant factors, including the seriousness of the offense, the court concludes that sentence adjustment is not warranted. 

-  signed by the Court (electronically)

Copy mailed to defendant
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. mag
Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  (Darionta Phifer - #603703, Prairie du Chien Correctional Institution, PO Box 9900, Prairie du Chien WI 53821).

Certification of HEARING - PART 2 transcript commencing 02/07/17 received and filed. (38 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Public Defender Appointment, District Attorney, and Institution.
Transcript HEARING - PART 2, commencing FEBRUARY 7, 2017, received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF4681 (34 Pages).
Due date based on this case, 15CF4681 and 15CF4318

Defendant Darionta Dashaun Phifer in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Darionta Dashaun Phifer in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

PSI reviewed and corrections made. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 108 MONTHS with 295 (two hundred ninety-five) days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 72 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program. 

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.
- No contact with Bank Mutual or 1000 feet of 2723 N. 20th Street:
- No contact with Alex W., Jordan N. or Tyrell J.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $6616.00 payable to Bank Mutual at 8050 W. Capital Drive or Corporate Headquarters (joint and several to co-actors Jordan Novak case #14CF328 and Tyrell Jefferson #14CF1435 for this case ONLY:
All mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution (including DNA); Court WAIVED non-mandatory costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

presentence investigation report received and filed.

Defendant Darionta D Phifer in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Darionta D Phifer in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Branch 37,  in Room 313 of the Safety Bldg. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
